dataset.title: The fractured lab notebook: undergraduate and ecological data management training in the United States

creator.organizationName: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis

abstract.para:
Data presented here are those collected from a survey of Ecology professors at 48 undergraduate institutions to assess the current state of data management education. The following files have been uploaded:
Scripts(2): 1. DataCleaning_20120105.R is an R script for cleaning up data prior to analysis. This script removes spaces, substitutes text for codes, removed duplicate schools, and converts questions and answers from the survey into more simple parameter names, without any numbers, spaces, or symbols. This script is heavily annotated to assist the user of the file in understanding what is being done to the data files. The script produces the file cleandata_[date].Rdata, which is called in the file DataTrimming_20120105.R 2. DataTrimming_20120105.R is an R script for trimming extraneous variables not used in final analyses. Some variables are combined as needed and NAs (no answers) are removed. The file is heavily annotated. It produces trimdata_[date].Rdata, which was imported into Excel for summary statistics.
Data files (3) 3. AdvancedSpreadsheet_20110526.csv is the output file from the SurveyMonkey online survey tool used for this project. It is a .csv sheet with the complete set of survey data, although some data (e.g., open-ended responses, institution names) are removed to prevent schools and/or instructors from being identifiable. This file is read into DataCleaning_20120105.R for cleaning and editing. 4. VariableRenaming_20110711.csv is called into the DataCleaning_20120105.R script to convert the questions and answers from the survey into simple parameter names, without any numbers, spaces, or symbols. 5. ParamTable.csv is a list of the parameter names used for analysis and the value codes. It can be used to understand outputs from the scripts above (cleandata_[date].Rdata and trimdata_[date].Rdata).

section.title: Methods
section.para:
Universities and colleges most likely contribute to the teaching of future graduate students in ecology were selected by using the following 3 methods. First, the US News and World Report's "Best Graduate Schools" website was used to identify the top ten Ecology and Evolutionary Biology graduate schools in the United States in 2010. Second, the website www.PhDs.org was used to collate a list of graduate schools in ecology with high National Research Council (NRC) Quality Measures. The NRC Quality Measure was set to priority five out of a possible five with all other priorities set to zero (not considered). Third, the same method as method two was used, except that the priority was set to five for Research Quality of the institution. And lastly, we obtained a list of the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship recipients for 2006 to 2010 for the life sciences. We removed the following areas of study: biochemistry, biophysics, cell biology, computational biology, developmental biology, genetics, immunology, molecular biology, neurosciences, and nutrition. The number of awards per institution were tallied and the Carnegie Classification system was used to determine whether schools were Research Universities (RU) or Baccalaureate/Arts and Sciences (BAS) institutions. BAS institutions with more than 4 awards were used in the survey. Based on these methods, a list of 51 target institutions were generated for the survey.
Each institution's website was extensively searched to determine which course(s) were applicable for the survey. Fit was determined subjectively based on the course description, course requirements for ecology-related majors, and the academic department(s) housing the course. After the most appropriate course was identified, the department was contacted to verify that the course selected was appropriate for the survey. The person contacted was the department chair, the undergraduate course advisor, or a professor within the department.
The survey consisted of 33 questions that fell into four categories: (1) basic course characteristics, such as class size, laboratory components, reading materials, and prerequisites; (2) the extent to which data management is covered and use of data in the course; (3) instructor opinion about the importance of data management education for undergraduates and perceived barriers to teaching topics related to data management; and (4) instructor characteristics, including year of PhD, percentage of time teaching versus conducting research, and data sharing practices.
The survey was conducted online using Survey Monkey. Emails to instructors were sent out 29 March 2011 and the survey was closed 25 May 2011.

dataTable.entityDescription: R script for cleaning up data prior to analysis. This script removes spaces, substitutes text for codes, removed duplicate schools, and converts questions and answers from the survey into more simple parameter names, without any numbers, spaces, or symbols. This script is heavily annotated to assist the user of the file in understanding what is being done to the data files. The script produces the file cleandata_[date].Rdata, which is called in the file DataTrimming_20120105.R

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is an R script to clean up data prior to analysis.

dataTable.entityDescription: R script for trimming extraneous variables not used in final analyses. Some variables are combined as needed and NAs (no answers) are removed. The file is heavily annotated. It produces trimdata_[date].Rdata, which was imported into Excel for summary statistics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is an R script to trim extraneous variables not used in the final analyses.

Unique 10-digit ID given to respondents
remove
remove

Question: What major is recommended by your department if a student is interested in pursuing a graduate degree in Ecology? (Open-Ended Response) Responses to ppen ended questions are not provided here in this data set. Courses were, however, limited to undergraduate courses that covered basic topics in Ecology.

textDomain.definition: Open ended responses are not provided in this dataset

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Is this course required for the major you named in your answer above? In the survey, the phrase "this course" refers to the course mentioned in the instructor's invitation email.

codeDefinition.definition: No, the course is not required
Yes, the course is required

Question: In the answer choices below "separate laboratory course" means the laboratory must be registered for separately apart from the main Ecology course and receives a distinct grade. Please select the situation that best describes laboratory sessions associated with this Ecology course.

codeDefinition.code: There are no laboratory sessions associated with this course
codeDefinition.definition: There are no laboratory session associated with this course.

codeDefinition.code: There is a separate laboratory course that is optional
codeDefinition.definition: There is a separate laboratory course that is optional

codeDefinition.code: The laboratory sessions are built into this course
codeDefinition.definition: There is a separate laboratory course that is mandatory

codeDefinition.code: There is a separate laboratory course that is mandatory
codeDefinition.definition: The laboratory sessions are built into this course

codeDefinition.definition: No, I am not able to answer questions about the separate laboratory course's curriculum and assessment
Yes, I am able to answer questions regarding the separate laboratory course's curriculum and assessment

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: If you answered "No" above please provide the name and contact email for the person(s) best able to answer questions about the separate laboratory course. - Open-Ended Response

textDomain.definition: Email addresses provided in the surveys are not provided for this dataset

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Are students that take this course expected to have prior knowledge about notebook protocols (lab or field)? Please note that for the remainder of the survey (e.g. remaining columns), only the mandatory components of the course were considered for the instructor's responses. If there was a separate laboratory that was optional, the instructor was told to disregard it when answering questions.

codeDefinition.definition: No, students are not expected to have prior knowledge
Yes, students are expected to have prior knowledge

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Are students that take this course expected to have prior knowledge about reproducibility: making sure results are reproducible which requires data metadata and analytical information?

codeDefinition.definition: No, students are not expected to have prior knowledge about reproducibility
Yes, students are expected to have prior knowledge about reproducibility

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Are students that take this course expected to have prior knowledge about data management: includes quality control metadata (data about data) generation using consistent and stable file formats protecting and archiving data?

codeDefinition.definition: No, students are not expected to have prior knowledge about data management
Yes, students are expected to have prior knowledge about data management

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Indicate which of the following are used in the assessment of the notebook (select all that apply): Quality control: making sure that data are accurate and there are no missing values or errors. Naming computer files: assigning descriptive file names that indicate spatial and/or temporal information about the data. Types of files and software to use. Metadata generation: descriptive information describing data content, context, quality, structure, etc. Workflows: detailed description, flow chart, or computer script of how raw data were transformed into final results. Protecting data: backing up data, creating multiple copies in multiple locations. None of the above. Notebooks are not assessed.

codeDefinition.definition: Making sure that data are accurate and there are no missing values or errors

codeDefinition.definition: Instructors were encouraged by their home institution to share data

attribute.attributeDefinition: Question: Any additional thoughts or comments? - Open-Ended Response

This dataset is called into the DataCleaning_20120105.R script to convert the questions (this column) and answers (next column) from the survey into simple parameter names, without any numbers, spaces, or symbols.

This dataset is called into the DataCleaning_20120105.R script to convert the questions (previous column) and answers (this column) from the survey into simple parameter names, without any numbers, spaces, or symbols.

This dataset provides a list of the parameter names used for analysis and the value codes. This dataset can be used to understand outputs from the scripts above (cleandata_[date].Rdata and trimdata_[date].Rdata). This columns provides the parameter names.
Description of the parameter name
Value codes for the parameters
